newsitem.title: CHINA: China shuts two asset evaluators, suspends five.
newsitem.headline: China shuts two asset evaluators, suspends five.

text.p: China has closed down two asset evaluation agencies and suspended five others as part of its drive to standardise the more than 3,300 agencies engaged in valuing state assets, the official Xinhua news agency said on Friday.
The agencies employ a total of more than 55,000 professional valuers. Beijing has been trying to standardise the industry to stop the undervaluation of state assets.

Xinhua said the State Administration of State Property had stripped the Zhongyu Certified Public Accountants and the Beijing Xinhua Certified Public Accountants of their asset evaluation licences after a sector survey found them unqualified.
The administration also suspended the Zhongqing Certified Public Accountants and Guangda Asset Evaluation Co and ordered them to meet business requirements within a set period of time, Xinhua said.
The administration suspended three other asset evaluation agencies, it said but gave no further details.
